greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest number strictly less than n with same factorization pattern.
comment: A064802 gives next larger comparable number. Ratio of a(n) to n is ratio of successive primes (n>2).
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
example: a(18)=12 because 18=2*3*3 and next smaller comparable factorization is 2*2*3=12.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{g, h}, g[x_] := Flatten[Table[#1, {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ x]; h[x_] := If[x == 2, 1, NextPrime[x, -1]]; If[n == 1, 1, Max[Times @@ MapAt[h, g[n], #] & /@ Range[Length@ g[n]]]]]; Table[f@ i, {i, 2, 74}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 31 2015 *)
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, May 06 2004
